@galactica147 changing the environment variable from within python may not work if the cuda runtime is initialized before you change it, or if you change it in a scope that won't be seen by the cuda driver.
You should change CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES before launching your script to be sure, or use torch.cuda.set_device(dev_id) from within your python script.

body:
@galactica147 changing the environment variable from within python may not work if the cuda runtime is initialized before you change it, or if you change it in a scope that won't be seen by the cuda driver.
You should change `CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES` before launching your script to be sure, or use `torch.cuda.set_device(dev_id)` from within your python script.
